page.title: 13Countess Wear Estate
page.content: Although much of the estate was built within a few years in the 1950's there is a surprising amount of diversity in both style and materials used. The majority of the homes were two storey houses of family size. Most of them (about 270) were semi-detached. There were some flats (about 100) which were smaller. There were a few bungalows mainly built for the older people of the community. Building materials varied. The most popular was red brick, but there were also some rendered houses (about 70). Some units were obviously erected swiftly after the war as they were pre-fabricated - made from concrete panels and either hung with tiles or tin sheeting on the upper floor. Most of the homes have gardens, many are now privately owned.
